awd_titl_txt: On-line Avoidance of Monitoring Intrusion in Distributed    Systems
awd_abstract_narration: Run-time monitoring provides an effective means for aiding  in the difficult tasks of developing, testing and  maintaining distributed computations. However, monitoring  activities introduce intrusion, which can potentially  alter the behavior of the computation being monitored. This  project is investigating techniques to  accommodate  the  effects of monitoring intrusion such that a computation will  exhibit the same behavior while being monitored as it would  have  exhibited in the absence of monitoring. This project  focuses on a  variety of approaches, which encompass  processor scheduling, communication protocols, time  maintenance and process synchronization. The techniques  developed will be incorporated into a system for the  on-  line monitoring of distributed computations, for  experimentation  and evaluation. This project is conducted  jointly by Madalene Spezialetti of Trinity College, CT and  Rajiv Gupta of University of Pittsburgh under grant CCR  9704350.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations
